greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of digraphs on n unlabeled vertices such that every vertex has outdegree k, n >= 1, 0 <= k < n.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
program: permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
E(v, x) = {my(r=1/(1-x)); for(i=1, #v, r=serconvol(r, prod(j=1, #v, my(g=gcd(v[i], v[j])); (1 + x^(v[j]/g))^g)/(1 + x))); r}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 08 2019
